title: Wagner - Gotterdammerung - Knappertsbusch (1955, Orfeo) [4CDs]
description:
* CD info
Wagner - Gotterdammerung (Twilight of the Gods) - Hans Knappertsbusch & Orchester der Bayerischen Staatsoper - Orfeo, 1955

Siegfried --- Bernd Aldenhoff
Gunther ----- Hermann Uhde
Hagen ------- Gottlob Frick
Alberich ---- Otokar Kraus
Brunnhilde -- Birgit Nilsson
Gutrune ----- Leonie Rysanek
Waltraude --- Ira Malaniuk
Woglinde ---- Gerda Sommerschuh
Wellgunde --- Elisabeth Lindermeier
Flosshilde -- Ruth Michaelis

* About the recording
Knappertsbusch is widely considered as being among the greatest Wagner conductors of all time. His renditions have a strong distinguishing feature: they are slow and massive in order to achieve an overwhelming tension and drama - far from hysterical and nervous interpretations that were more in vogue in the second half of the XXth century.
The casting is lavish, between Birgit Nilsson in her prime and Gottlob Frick with his bass voice incredibly dark and deep.
The sound is okay thanks to Orfeo remastering: really not bad for a live recording from 1955, but saturate easily when too loud.

* Technicals 
Total duration - 04h 23m 01s
Average bitrate - 364 kbps
Encoder - FLAC 1.3.1, lossless, compression level 5


* Tracks
Too long to list here, please see: http://www.allmusic.com/performance/die-g%C3%B6tterd%C3%A4mmerung-twilight-of-the-gods-opera-wwv-86d-mq0000367410
